title: Letter Swap
description:
This message uses a simple substitution cipher where each letter maps to another:

Usvt: gszh{uivjfvmxb_zmzobhrh_drmh}

The most common letter in English is 'E'. In this ciphertext, 'v' appears most frequently.

Crack the cipher to find the flag.
hints: If v=e, look at the structure: gszh{...} looks like flag{...}
Map g→f, s→l, z→a, h→g to get 'flag' — now you have 5 letter mappings
Use frequency analysis and known plaintext patterns to map the rest
